title: New York State Senate Republicans Squabble Over Campaign Money
text:
A campaign committee controlled by state Senate Republicans has been accused of refusing to repay $100,000 to former Sen. Cathy Young’s campaign because she tried to oust Senate Minority Leader John Flanagan last year.

The allegation is included in a lawsuit filed this spring in state court in Cattaraugus County, and spawned a continuing legal fight that shows the lingering resentment between a prominent Republican and her former colleagues that could deliver a blow to the GOP’s campaign coffers.

...
